content: a marker hb a front stitch across all chain 1 and turn row 4 - ws hb b back stitch across all chain 1 and turn row 5 7 & 9- repeat row 3 row 6 8 & 10 repeat row 4 continue this two row hb repeat until you reach your desired length depending on your preference you can slip_stitch trim before you fasten_off don t forget to block your final piece to shape it and weave in any ends you can block it now before joining the sides to lay it flat or if preferred after assembly assembly with rs together join the sides by sewing the loops together from the bottom hem to the marker you used to note your preferred armhole depth using a mattress stitch neckline & armhole trim to finish the neckline join your yarn approx 10 st from a v point and slip_stitch around - decreasing at each v point by joining the stitch before the v the v_stitch and the stitch after the v to slip_stitch 3 together you can chain 1 and continue to slip_stitch the desired number of row e g 5 around the neckline for these row at each v point slip_stitch only the stitch before and after the v neck together note if your neckline is too deep you can always sew the middle to shorten the neckline before adding the trim as you did for the neckline if preferred slip_stitch around each armhole to finish the edge advanced option that uses more yarn an alternative finish is a flat border stitch that like the hb stitch uses the previous vertical stitch with a 4mm hook single_crochet in the first stitch insert the hook in the vertical bar if the stitch you just made insert the hook in the next stitch and yarn over to pull the loop through making 3 loops on your hook and also trough the next loop then yo and pull through the last two loops chain 1 for row 2 and 3 single_crochet in the back loop only insert the hook in the vertical bar the blo on the next stitch yo and pull through this stitch and the next loop as before yo and pull through the remaining two loops check out our tutorial video s to see all the ways to customize this simple pattern size medium vertical vs horizontal crop vs 50 cm length all pattern proceeds not to be reproduced or great gift ideas donated to canadian distributed charities & nonprofits
